another.translation[0].definitions[0].de: one more person or thing of the same type
another.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I’m going to have another cup of coffee.
There’ll be another bus along in a few minutes.
Buy two CDs and get another completely free.
Oh look, there’s another one of those birds.
This misunderstanding is yet another example of bad communication  (=there have already been several).
We’ll have to wait another three weeks for the results.
Is this another of your schemes to make money?
another.translation[0].definitions[1].de: not the same thing, person etc, but a different one
another.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: They must have returned by another route.
We finally moved to another apartment.
I’m busy right now. Could you come back another time?
Helen resigned from her last job and has yet to find another.
She spends the day rushing from one meeting to another.
The gold watch was a present from another of his girlfriends.
another.translation[0].definitions[2].de: used with the name of a well-known person, thing, event etc to mean someone or something else that is similar because they have the same good or bad qualities
another.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: warnings that not enough has been done to prevent another Chernobyl
There’ll never be another Elvis Presley.
another.translation[0].note_box[0].items: Another is written as one word  Don’t write
There must be another way of doing it
